newsitem.title: FRANCE: Pathe has no comment on BSkyB stake.
newsitem.headline: Pathe has no comment on BSkyB stake.

text.p: France's Pathe on Monday declined comment on a British newspaper report that it might sell its 17 percent stake in British Sky Broadcasting Group Plc (BSkyB).
However, a Pathe spokesman said the company was satisfied with the performance of BSkyB and with its cooperation with the British satellite television company.
The Sunday Telegraph said Pathe might sell the stake, valued at 1.8 billion pounds. The stake represented too much money tied up in one asset for Pathe, the paper said.
"These are rumours of purely journalistic origin. Pathe does not wish to comment on rumours published by a British newspaper," the Pathe spokesman said.
Pathe was "very satisfied with the performance and its cooperation with BSkyB," he said.
Pathe shares surged on the Paris bourse on the newspaper report. They were 106 francs higher at 1,524 francs at 1102 GMT.
Pathe, created from the break up of Chargeurs last year, is due to publish its 1996 results on Tuesday after the Paris bourse close at 1600 GMT.
